title: google-antigravity/claude-opus-4-6-thinking not discovered from Antigravity API
body:
## Description

`claude-opus-4-6-thinking` is available in the Google Antigravity API but OpenClaw 2026.2.6 doesn't recognize it as a valid model.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Authenticate with Google Antigravity (`openclaw auth login google-antigravity`)
2. Run `openclaw models list`
3. Observe that `google-antigravity/claude-opus-4-6-thinking` shows as `missing`

## Expected Behavior

The model should appear as available since it exists in the Antigravity API response:

```json
{
  "claude-opus-4-6-thinking": {
    "displayName": "Claude Opus 4.6 (Thinking)",
    "quotaInfo": {
      "remainingFraction": 0.6,
      "resetTime": "2026-02-07T07:58:36Z"
    }
  }
}
```

## Actual Behavior

```
google-antigravity/claude-opus-4-6-thinking  ...  default,configured,missing
```

## Analysis

The `@mariozechner/pi-coding-agent` library (v0.52.7) has hardcoded model definitions but doesn't include `claude-opus-4-6-thinking`. The Antigravity provider fetches quota info dynamically but model definitions are static.

`model-resolver.js` has:
```js
"google-antigravity": "gemini-3-pro-high"
```

But no Claude Opus 4.6 Thinking variant.

## Environment

- OpenClaw: 2026.2.6 (f831c48)
- pi-coding-agent: 0.52.7
- Node: v22.22.0
- OS: Linux 6.14.0-1021-gcp

## Workaround

Using `google-antigravity/claude-opus-4-5-thinking` as fallback (works).
